net.floodlightcontroller.nbextension
Class IPv4RoutingTables

java.lang.Object
  net.floodlightcontroller.nbextension.IPv4RoutingTables
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.floodlightcontroller.core.IListener<org.openflow.protocol.OFType>, net.floodlightcontroller.core.IOFMessageListener, net.floodlightcontroller.core.module.IFloodlightModule, net.floodlightcontroller.core.module.IFloodlightService, IRoutingTableService
public class IPv4RoutingTables
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.floodlightcontroller.core.module.IFloodlightModule, net.floodlightcontroller.core.IOFMessageListener, IRoutingTableService

Support for providing per-switch IPv4 routing table information.

Configuration parameters:

Note: The parameters listed in the table below must be prefaced in the floodlight configuration file with the string that identifies parameters for the floodlight module instance (class) that will provide the service. Unless subclassed, the string "net.floodlightcontroller.nbextension.IPv4RoutingTables." would be used for this module.

Configuration Parameter Name Data Type Default Description
"IPv4RoutingConfigPath" file path "ipv4_routing.json" A path to a JSON-formatted file containing static IPv4 routing information.

IPv4 routing information file:

The content of this JSON formatted file is a single JSON object in which each element key string is the (hex or MAC) datapath identifier (dpid) of the switch for which the routing data applies. Each value is an array of routing entry JSON objects, which may contain one of the following fields;

  • "dest": "IPv4-address" or "IPv4-address/mask-bits"
  • "mask": "IPv4-address-mask"
  • "gateway": "IPv4-hostable-address"
  • "linkaddr": "assignable-link-layer-address"
  • "port": "physical-switch-port"

Notes:

  • At least one of "dest" or "gateway" must be specified.
  • It is an error to supply both mask-bits and IPv4-address-mask.
  • If neither mask-bits nor IPv4-address-mask provided, the default net mask is all-bits-on (255.255.255.255).
  • The "linkaddr" parameter is for the gateway host and may not be specified unless the gateway host is specified.
  • The "port" parameter is for the gateway host's link-layer address and may not be specified unless the gateway host's link-layer address is specified.
  • The order of the entries defines precedence. Source host is unkown and unknowable.

In addition to a datapath identifier element key string in the root level JSON object, the literal element key string "IPv4DHCP" may be specified which controls the dynamic monitoring of DHCP traiffic to obtain the routing table data. The default is false. The value of this entry may be one of:

  • "OFF", "DISABLE", or "FALSE" to turn off DHCP monitoring entirely,
  • "ON", "ENABLE", or "TRUE" to allow unfiltered DHCP monitoring, or
  • an array of filter specifications each of which describes the DHCP traffic to allow to dynamically update the routing tables. An empty array is the equivalent of "OFF". Each array element filter specification is a JSON object with at least one of the following keys:
    • "dpid": "hex or MAC" only allow packets from specified switch.
    • "src_linkaddr": "hex or MAC" only allow packets with source link address.
    • "src_ipv4": "IPv4-address" only allow packets with (UDP) source IP address.
    • "dhcp_server_id": "IPv4-address" only allow packets with matching DHCP server ID option.
    • "no_match": "boolean" if true only allow packets with a reason code that is "no-match". if false only allow packets with a reason code that is not "no-match".
    • "in_port": "switch-port" only allow packets with matching input switch-port.

Notes:

  • When configured with more than one filter, a DHCP packet must match at least one of the filters to be allowed to update the IPv4 routing table.
  • An entire routing table derived from a DHCP packet is replaced on update if it is not a content-match of the existing table. No merging of tables for a given switch will be attempted.
  • Only one IPv4 routing table is retained per datapath ID (i.e., per switch). If more than one subnet with DHCP services are operating through a single switch managed by this controller and the corresponding DHCP packets are allowed to update this module's IPv4 routine tables, the IPv4 routing table assigned to the switch will be determined by the last qualifying DHCP packet seen.

Example: 

 {
   "00:01:02:03:04:01": [
     { "dest":    "192.168.1.0/24" },
     { "gateway": "192.168.1.1" },
   ],
   "00:01:02:03:04:02": [
     { "dest":    "10.0.1.0",    "mask": "255.255.255.0" },
     { "gateway": "10.0.1.1",    "linkaddr": "A0:36:9F:23:27:C7"},
   ],
   "00:01:02:03:04:03": [
     { "dest":    "10.0.2.0/24" },
     { "dest":    "10.0.0.0/16", "gateway": "10.0.0.1" }
     { "gateway": "10.0.2.1",    "linkaddr": "A0:36:9F:23:27:C8", "port": 3},
   ],
   "IPv4DHCP": [
     { "dpid": "0x000102030404", "src_ipv4": "10.0.6.6" }
   ]
 }
